features: 【320 PAGES＆100GSM THICK PAPER】Large A5 size (5.75"x 8.38"/146mm x 213mm), 7mm space classic college ruled notebook, total 320 pages, include 312 numbered pages (27 lines on each page) /156 sheets to provide you ample space to write. 100gsm acid free light Ivory paper that is thicker than normal, will not cause bleeding, ghosting or smudging and is suit for most types pens.

【PREMIUM VEGAN LEATHER HARD COVER】Made from high quality vegan leather, no animals were harmed, and have a sumptuous vintage look and a comfortable touch. Durable and water-resistant hard cover can protects the inside of the page better than a soft cover and provides a comfortable writing surface. Combined with a sturdy thread-bound binding, the leather notebook can easily to lay out flat.

【HUMANIZED DESIGN】5 Contents Pages to log more entries. No more worrying about not having enough index pages; 2 Exquisite ribbon bookmarks to help you find content faster; 1 Elastic closure band to keep your pages safe; 1 pen holder to make your pen no longer alone; 1 Back Inner pocket for stashing notes, small gadgets, etc; Rounded corner design makes the lined notebook not easy to be damaged and curled.

【FREE INDEX TABS STICKERS】Each leather bound journal comes with 1 gift of multicolor index tabs stickers for papers classifying and marking. The free index stickers also can help you mark and identify your subjects, you can quickly flip to the section you're looking for.

【WIDE USAGE& GIFTABLE】OFFIGIFT thick hardcover notebook is ideal for office, school and home use, and is a great gift choice for women, men, business executives, college, students, adults, scientists, and people in many other fields. It can be used as personal writing journal, daily journal, to do list notebook, business notebooks, college/school course notebooks, note taking journal and more.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Thick, sturdy, and ready for anything.
The perfect notebook for your big ideas.
↓↓↓Click to watch the video for more information↓↓↓

Page count, lines per page, and line spacing? Total 320 pages (equal to 160 sheets, 1 sheet = 2 pages), incl. personal info page + 5 index pages + 312 numbered pages. A5: 27 lines each page, B5: 34 lines each page, A4: 36 lines each page. Standard College Ruled, 7mm line spacing. Why are there page numbers and 5 index pages? 1.Easy navigation: Page numbers & index pages for quick access to notes & sections. 2.Better organization: Categorize & archive notes by topic or date. 3.Efficient reference: Index pages provide a visual overview, saving time in finding information. Is the paper thick enough? Will it bleed through? We have employed exclusive innovative paper technology on our 100gsm thick paper to provide a perfect canvas for your ideas - no bleeding, no ghosting. We have tested writing with various popular pen brands and confirmed no ink penetration. What binding method is used? Is it lay-flat and lefty-friendly? We use innovative thread binding, allowing the notebook to lay flat at 180°, accommodating left-handed and right-handed users. This binding method ensures durability and prevents loose or detached pages, surpassing glue binding in reliability. I would like to make a bulk purchase. Is there a discount available? Certainly! You can search for ASIN: B0C3B3QZFQ or visit our store OFFIGIFT to find the link for a 5-pack bundle. It offers a 50% discount compared to purchasing individual notebooks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smooth Pages for a Satisfying Writing Experience and more...
reviews.reviewText: I recently got my hands on this notebook, it is a sturdy notebook for anyone who loves jotting down thoughts, doodling, or simply keeping organized in a tactile way. Here's why this notebook is a must-have.Just the Right SizeIt is the right size for tote bags for backpack and large enough to provide ample writing space. This makes it incredibly convenient for on-the-go note-taking, whether you're in a café, on a train, or simply moving from one meeting to another.Smooth Pages for a Satisfying Writing ExperienceThe paper quality is exceptional. The pages are smooth, almost inviting you to write on them. If you're a fan of gel pens like I am, you're in for a treat. The ink glides effortlessly across the page, making the writing experience not just satisfactory but downright enjoyable. No feathering, no bleed-through; just crisp, clean lines every time.One of my favorite features has to be the small pocket at the back. It's a simple addition that offers so much utility. I use it to store sticky notes, bookmarks, and even the occasional business card or receipt. It's like a little treasure trove that keeps all those small but essential items in one place.The notebook also comes with not one, but two sateen ribbon markers. This is especially useful for someone who likes to multitask between different sections of the notebook. I use one marker for my daily to-do lists and the other for jotting down random thoughts and ideas. The sateen texture adds a touch of luxury that I didn't know I needed but now can't do without.Overall, this notebook is a perfect blend of form and function. Its optimal size, high-quality pages, handy back pocket, dual sateen markers, and appealing color options make it a standout choice for anyone in need of a reliable, yet stylish, writing companion. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: Perfect! I love that it has two ribbon sewn in bookmarks as well as a pen holder, back pocket and elastic! Everything I need in a journal for a decent price. I love the size and the cover which is not too hard nor too soft. The paper quality is high and it has a table of content area and page numbers. Seriously everything I could have wanted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are amazing notebooks. I bought two and certainly will buy more when needed. They are so much thicker than I imagined, very sturdy, beautiful and fantastically functional. The pen holder, interior folder, table of contents and included stickies are all big perks. I am starting grad school after years out of school and knew I wanted a notebook I could take with with long after school and refer back to even years later, not the flimsy spiral books I used in undergrad. This was perfect. I never expected to be writing a review for a notebook but here I am, just buy one for yourself and you’ll see.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comparable to Leuchtturm!
reviews.reviewText: This journal is great! As a Leuchtturm user I have been kind of going through the alternatives just to see, and this is the closest so far to what I like in a book. I love the blue color. Similar to Leuchtturm, it has two bookmark ribbons, numbered pages, and a table of contents. Then to take it to the next level, it has more pages, a pen loop, and it comes with tab/page markers!My two MINOR cons with this is 1) the paper is still a little too thick/stiff for me, but it’s better than the paper in the Beechmore journal I reviewed earlier this year. I don’t use fountain pens though, so the softer Leuchtturm paper is still my favorite, but the thickness of the book overall and the fact that it still lays flat is great. And 2) even more minor, the vegan leather cover feels a little cheap to me, also stiff. I’m thinking however it will break in with regular use and feel a little more familiar.Also, the elastic band is pretty solid too- some books have a loose band which I can’t stand. Not the case here.All in all I do recommend this for others like me who are used to Leuchtturm but might want something a bit cheaper. This is the one!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Pros: Love the thickness of the pages! The cover is soft to the touch. There is a place to make an index, a place to write who it belongs to as well as offer a reward, and a few pages in the back to test different pens. The sticky tabs included are nice and the back storage pocket seems sturdy, the fabric is glued in between two sheets of paper. I love that it has a place for a pen/pencil. There are two different colored place holding ribbons which are nice and a good length.Con’s: I was disappointed with the color being more of a mustard yellow instead of the yellow color that seemed in picture. Be careful when turning the pages the first few bend up unless you are turning the page from the outer side of the page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It has a table of contents, 300 something pages, a back pouch thing that comes with highlighter sticky notes, I page holder strap, two bookmark strings! a pen holder!!! It’s great. The pages don’t bleed even when writing/coloring with marker.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love the color!
reviews.reviewText: I got this for work to take notes and love it. It is the perfect size, durable, and very pretty! Comes with extras that I loved as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love the Leather Journal
reviews.reviewText: I love practicing my modern calligraphy in a journal so I can track my progress, so I purchased this journal for a beginner's gift. Sturdy, well made, and perfect for any type of writing/drawing/doodling. I will buy this again. Love that it comes in so many colors and sizes.

I’m super picky about my journals and I’ve been searching for the perfect one for months. The paper is smooth and thick to write on, and the journal itself is very sturdy and flattens very easily (but also takes no damage from being flattened like most journals do). Each page is numbered, and it comes with 5 content pages (as shown in picture) so you can easily access specific content within your journal. It also comes with 312 pages, an envelope/folder attached to the back of the journal which also contains dividers/stickers/sticky notes. I love the journal so much! I would recommend it to anybody in the need of a good, long lasting journal at a good price.
Sidorna är tjocka och bra, lite blankare än jag trodde men blyerts fäster okej ändå. Bra pärm som tål lite fukt utan att bli fläckig.
Ce carnet est parfait! La taille est idéale et le fait de pouvoir faire une table des matières au début du cahier est vraiment parfait! C’est tout ce qu’il me fallait!

Comodo e molto pratico. Lo sto usando a lavoro ed è fantastico. Ha le pagine che si aprono facilmente come un libro ed ha i posti fluo per segnare le pagine. In fondo c'è anche una tasca dove mettere eventualmente fogli.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Probably the only review you will need!
reviews.reviewText: It may not be possible to emphasise enough how this is the best value journal/ notebook out there. You may even struggle to get anything better at any price point.As a fountain pen user, the no bleed pages are a major plus as one of the reviews stated they bleed which raised concerns. I use the Mont Blanc 146 (medium nib), Bond and Regent (medium nib), Scriveiner (broad nib) and Wordsworth & Black (medium nib). I can confirm non of them bled.The other plus that’s hard to beat is the build quality and that feel that makes you sit straighter than usual and write more carefully. I know it may seem like just a journal and maybe difficult to explain.Oh, and there is the dual bookmarks, the band to hold it shut, the content pages at the front, the numbered pages, the stickers and pouch at the back.For reference, used Leuchtturm and Oxford journals last 3 years, which were the best for my needs at that time but this one is better by far.Thanks for reading my review!.Disclaimer: I have not been paid for this review! As a writer, things like this excite and this notebook surely did. How could I not have seen this earlier?
